seg-source.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_RESET_PASSWORD system procedure

target.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_RESET_PASSWORD system procedure

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_RESET_PASSWORD</codeph> system procedure resets a password that has expired or has been forgotten.

seg-source.mrk: USERNAME

target.mrk: USERNAME

trans-unit.source: A user name that is case-sensitive if you place the name string in double quotes. This user name is an authorization identifier. See "Authorization identifiers, user authentication, and user authorization" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information about how these names are treated.

seg-source.mrk: A user name that is case-sensitive if you place the name string in double quotes.
This user name is an authorization identifier.
See "Authorization identifiers, user authentication, and user authorization" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information about how these names are treated.

target.mrk: A user name that is case-sensitive if you place the name string in double quotes.

seg-source.mrk: Execute privileges

target.mrk: Execute privileges

trans-unit.source: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default. See "Using NATIVE authentication," "Enabling user authentication," and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information. The database owner can grant access to other users.

seg-source.mrk: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default.
See "Using NATIVE authentication," "Enabling user authentication," and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.
The database owner can grant access to other users.

seg-source.mrk: JDBC example

trans-unit.source: Reset the password of a user named FRED:

seg-source.mrk: Reset the password of a user named FRED:

target.mrk: Reset the password of a user named FRED:

trans-unit.source: CallableStatement cs = conn.prepareCall ("CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_RESET_PASSWORD(?, ?)"); cs.setString(1, "fred"); cs.setString(2, "temppassword"); cs.execute(); cs.close();

seg-source.mrk: CallableStatement cs = conn.prepareCall ("CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_RESET_PASSWORD(?, ?)"); cs.setString(1, "fred"); cs.setString(2, "temppassword"); cs.execute(); cs.close();

target.mrk: CallableStatement cs = conn.prepareCall ("CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_RESET_PASSWORD(?, ?)"); cs.setString(1, "fred"); cs.setString(2, "temppassword"); cs.execute(); cs.close();

seg-source.mrk: CallableStatement cs = conn.prepareCall ("CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_RESET_PASSWORD(?, ?)"); cs.setString(1, "\"FreD\""); cs.setString(2, "temppassword"); cs.execute(); cs.close();
